original_title: Insulin shortage pushes patients to private pharmacies
original_body_lines: Diabetes patients who depend on insulin provided by the state hospitals have been forced to purchase insulin from private pharmacies due to a shortage of insulin at state sector hospitals.
Spokesperson for the Government Medical Officers Association Dr. Chamal Wijesinghe told News 1st that from among them only a limited number have the means to purchase insulin vials.
He noted that many patients would experience a worsening health condition due to this situation.
